This is Caesar Martin soon filling in for any Burke want to give it a bank you daddy for having me hosts a host forum today ladies and gentlemen all you liberty loving people out there we as the king of liberty himself
Former chairman of the Alaska Libertarian Party the man that makes for Republicans and Democrats shaking their shoes when they're pushing the Marxist agenda Michael Chambers in Studio with us now hello Mike
Guy hello good morning Caesar glad to be here with
You are absolutely so you don't Michel ... first stop on the on the hour I Want to have a conversation with you about the shakeup in the governor's race you know I Know that you know bill Walker was your least favorite politician in Alaska and his campaign
For governor has been suspended duty the sexual improprieties Byron Milan and so Mike I Want to get your perspective out there you know for all the liberty ... minded folks out there I mean how do you see the race shaping up now with with Bill Walker being out and it coming down to beg it should've done Letty
During his ... where are these are you know most a talk show host these that kind of start out with a little bit of sip of
Coffee but you went through some red meat right out there that I'm telling you I Do yeah well uh you know I ah you're exactly right
Um I checked the mailbox every ah December and I haven't gotten any Christmas card from the government that you know I think you're exactly right in that regard I have a few of 'em up they're not just a Governor Walker but uh yeah this whole issue with regard to him suspending the campaign
You know a lot of people say well it was a set up and all that you know I I seriously doubt that the lieutenant governor or
A more would take that kind of a hit with regard to the ... for the for the team taking one where the team you know uh I I seriously doubt that I think that there's a lot of validity in the allegations out there
Right you're I I Would definitely agree with you Michael and
You know it's it's sort of interesting because you know you've been waging a battle against bill Walker for the last four years on the P. F. D. and the budget
Hammering them on Facebook go into public forums and hammering in public forums and so how does it feel cheap for you personally to see a man that that you've considered to be a disaster from day one
Of his administration to basically now he's going to be a one term I mean this is yet this is the end of his political career I mean what are what are your personal feelings about that
Well you know I think that there was a tremendous amount of people out there that contributed I did as much as I could do contribute and I can only say that my happy meters been packed here for quite a long time now and uh you know it was really interesting
Or four years ago you know Governor Walker or a Kennedy Walker came over to do the cutting home and sat down with a you know a large group of a United for liberty folks
And he uh made us very a prophetic statement there he said he's going to be a one term governor because of the positions that he would have to take with regard to lowering the footprint of governments
And ... you know at the debate with Mike Dunn levy in fear banks at that that was hosted by the chamber of commerce up there
Um I he was essentially walking back his position by saying well if there's any issues with ballot measure one I'll be able to fix it as governor which
Just as a as a point of information for listeners out there if ballot measure one has passed
The governor cannot do anything about it the legislature can't do anything about it for two years our constitution states all ballot initiatives if their parents cannot be amended
Or repealed until two years later so if a ballot measure one passage we're stuck with a job killing measure for two years so I mean aside from the fact that mark baggage clearly indicated that he does not understand state government and hasn't read our state constitution
You know Michael what is your take
On on the walking back of his of his support for ballot measure one and other issues
Well it you know it's really quite um an obvious or one of the issues that he has is that a consistently across the board the entire uh a native corporations and the native tribes have been in favor of a no on one
You know they've been against the stand for salmon um Bristol Bay is the only one that took a neutral stand on that but uh but they didn't come out in favor a stamper salmon so uh you know Mark Begich obviously trying to play to the
The native or vote out there and try to walk it back
But I think the real thing is is that he realizes that uh the stand for salmon is a is a job killer it it would destroy our economy and you know those aren't uh you know I'm not doing hyper boy here I'm just saying very clearly our economy
Is in a ride in the on the edge I think it's worth the economy in America you know so
We have the highest unemployment in the nation
Um I mean we are sort of slowly um ... you know we are in the sort of a slow recovery because of the increase um in production on the north slope and we're starting to see 'em you know jobs coming back in the oil sector but you know to your point Michael it's very clear
From any reading of of the ballot initiative that it is a threat to our to our economy I mean the amount that the amount of uh the permitting that you'd have to do to even be able to cross the stream for example on your TV
I'm is significant and when you have I mean there is so far there are four hundred and Seventy five businesses that have joined the stand for Alaska no on one coalition and I think that's significant I mean I I Will tell you that
I have never seen a ballot initiative campaign in our in our state
Um that has drawn that many businesses are into the coalition not to mention labor unions I mean the AFL CIO um is is strongly opposed to it I mean when you get Curtis there of the state chamber invincibility Romney in agreement on an issue that's significant
Or not to mention you know the threat that it poses to a economic development in rural Alaska but
It was that being said you know one of the other things about Mark Begich though I also find interesting with his campaign as he's made it very clear that he wants to amend the state constitution to guarantee funding for education
That's correct and you know Michael you know you're a teacher you were actually an award winning teacher and delta junction yes I'm you're someone that has been very passionate about education in terms of what it takes you know as far as teaching and engaging with children
To help them in the learning process so what is your assessment of Mark Begich is we're going to guarantee education funding in perpetuity well you know it sounds good you know I'm
I don't think that there's any citizen out there in Alaska that doesn't think that we shouldn't invest in education I mean that would be like crazy but you know reality says that uh there that we are as Michael Dunn levy says very succinctly
Is we're looking at a consistently the import of money instead of the output of performance correct and uh you know the bottom line is is that enough is enough ah you know it doesn't mean that are funding in education should be there but our main emphasis should certainly be
On a on the outcome of education and my concern is is that when you have an automatic payment going to education that is not accountable
It would even add even more so to the fact that they just have a you know a
A a large amount of money without any uh accountability whatsoever so I'm I'm extremely concerned about
That uh it sounds good uh like I say but you know just because it sounds good doesn't necessarily mean it is a
... absolutely and you know Michael one of the things I also wanted to ask you about is
You know Michael Dunn left the
Is it is a guy that has been for the last you know twenty um the last twenty five years of his life has been very involved at every level of education you know he's been a teacher he's been a principal he's been as superintendent
Um he was chairman of the the match to a school board before he was elected to the state Senate and twenty toll I mean this is a guy that has served it yet and you know he's got a teaching certificate principles certificate um two master's degrees in education I mean this was a guy that has served at every level conceivable in our educational system
And yet the NEA has endorsed Mark Begich they're not supporting Mike Dunn levy for governor um
Than Doris Mark Begich they're not supporting Mike Dunn levy for governor um and so what are your thoughts you know being a former teacher with a with a dynamic shaping up in the race
Well that's a very interesting point you bring out there ah she's our because uh I find it very interesting any a has always always supported teachers
Even to the exclusion of education

A vision or an experience with regard to ah to dealing with the real difficult task of a of a bringing education back into a

A absolutely and you know Michael when you look at you know at the uh you know going back to mark baggage

You know developing its talking points as it goes along you know do you see 'em any tightening up in the baggage camp or do you think it's kind of too late as far as them creating a cohesiveness around the campaign with regard to their talking points
Well if you look at their talking points you can tell from my perspective they're desperate
And the reason why I say that is is because mark baggage is coming out in the majority of conversations you having and he is
The people that are carrying his water are negative in nature and it is a consistent dialogue that if you're behind you go negative
Um it didn't work for me to read well um it's not going to work for a Mark Begich show I I don't think that just because they come out and try to attack Michael's record or
Attack of the things that Michael stands for or making innuendos out there about some kind of impropriety Michel might have any is in his ... his skeletons in his closet or whatever like that
You know I I Want to hear the visionary I Want to hear the leader I Want to hear the process of somebody saying you know we have a difficult time here in Alaska and I'm going to step up when I'm going to a you know what I'm going to run with a vision that is right beneficial for all of us and I don't hear that from the baggage campaign what I hear from them is mirrors
Tactics and all kinds of process to take down a good man Michael Dunn levy and and I think it's unfortunate that charge a state has a devolve down to having candidates of that nature of running for governor
I hear where you're coming from you Michael another thing I wanted to ask you do you think there's a real fear in the baggage camp because the public safety employees union which represents the state troopers um
Endorsed Mike Dunn levy for governor the chill is the corporation has endorsed Mike Dunn Libby for governor I'm you know Michael has has been getting um you know support in a number of different areas um it toward his campaign
You know when you look at Mark Begich of his campaign has struggled financially uh in terms of of getting money into his campaign he's gotten no support from the Democratic Governors Association
